alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne; Decatur; Rawlins; Sherman; Thomas (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Dust Storm Warning issued July 26 at 8:37PM CDT until July 26 at 10:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a * Dust Storm Warning for... Cheyenne County in northwestern Kansas... Northern Thomas County in northwestern Kansas... Rawlins County in northwestern Kansas... Southwestern Decatur County in northwestern Kansas... Northern Sherman County in northwestern Kansas... * Until 900 PM MDT/1000 PM CDT/. * At 736 PM MDT/836 PM CDT/, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 7 miles southwest of Benkelman to 13 miles south of St. Francis, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Near zero visibility with damaging wind in excess of 60 mph. SOURCE...Public. At 820 PM CT, multiple reports near zero visibility in Cheyenne and Northern Sherman counties. IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel on Highways 36 and 27. This wall of dust will remain over mainly rural areas of Cheyenne, northern Thomas, Rawlins, southwestern Decatur and northern Sherman Counties in northwestern Kansas, including the following locations... Wheeler, Blakeman and Beardsley. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Dust storms lead to dangerous driving conditions with visibility reduced to near zero. If driving, avoid dust storms if possible. If caught in one, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into a dust storm. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE! Strong to severe thunderstorms are also possible behind this wall of dust. Keep updated with this quickly evolving situation.
